Yes, here are a few joint activities your kids can do together to encourage positive interactions and minimize fighting:

1. Board games or puzzles: They can work together to solve a puzzle or play a board game that requires teamwork. 2. Arts and crafts: They can work on a craft or art project together, such as making a family collage, creating a comic strip, or painting a picture. 3. Outdoor activities: They could play in the garden or backyard or take a bike ride or hike together (supervised if needed). 4. Cooking or baking: They can assist you in baking or cooking and enjoy eating the finished product together. 5. Book clubs or storytelling: They can read a book or storybook together and discuss it, their favorite parts, or switch up and take turns making up stories for each other. Remember, through these types of activities, your children will learn teamwork and how to focus on a common goal, which can help them reduce their rivalry and promote cooperation. It's always essential to supervise their activities and make sure they have fun while maintaining safety.
